alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dickenson and southwestern Buchanan Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Haysi, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clintwood, Grundy, Haysi, Davenport, Breaks Interstate, John Flannagan Lake, Trammel, Clinchco, Nora, Vansant and McClure. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
